description: The round payoff this round was 90. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 22.5.
This is a variant of a prisoner's dilemma or coordination game, where mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest total payoff, but there's temptation to defect
The payoff structure creates tension between individual and collective interests - option 1 is collectively optimal but individually risky.
In the recorded round, Kate chose option 2 while John chose option 1, resulting in John receiving only 25% of half the round payoff (22.5 out of 90), which is suboptimal for John.
The repeated nature of the game allows for the development of trust or retaliation strategies based on previous rounds' outcomes.
